boundary="0000000000001e8678059f98c2f5" --0000000000001e8678059f98c2f5 Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8" Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable Hey there, Each year, we survey the product management industry to create our annual Product Management Insights Report, which offers an inside look into the past, current, and future state of the profession. This year, we surveyed more than 550 product managers and leaders on what they do, how they prioritize their time, favorite methodologies and best practices, and their most significant challenges. Though a 25-page report sounds daunting, there=E2=80=99s some great researc= h in there about how product leaders build successful products. I want to point out my 3 favorite findings: 1. *Product management has entered the C-Suite: *59% of product leaders said high-level objectives like incubating a new product or business lin= e was high on their list of priorities. 2. *The source of best product and feature ideas revealed:* 60% of PMs say direct customer feedback leads to their best ideas. 28% -- nearly a thir= d -- surprisingly admitted to copying competitors. 3. *Cross-functional collaboration will play a big role in 2020:* Despite a growing demand for consumer insights, 51% of respondents collaborate wit= h market research on less than half their projects *Download our 2020 Product Management Insights Report * Best, Shawna [image: Matt Davis] Shawna Lent *Head of Content at Alpha * Alpha, 588 Broadway - Suite 503, New York, NY 10012 United States You receive this email because you are a customer of Alpha. Update your email preferences to choose the types of emails you receive. Hey there,

Each year, we survey the product management industry to create our annual P= roduct Management Insights Report, which offers an inside look into the pas= t, current, and future state of the profession.

This year, we surveyed more than 550 product managers and leaders on what t= hey do, how they prioritize their time, favorite methodologies and best pra= ctices, and their most significant challenges.=C2=A0

Though a 25-page report sounds daunting, there=E2=80=99s some great researc= h in there about how product leaders build successful products. I want to p= oint out my 3 favorite findings:

  1. Product management has entered the C-Suite: 59% of product leaders said high-level objectives like incubating = a new product or business line was high on their list of priorities.=C2=A0<= /p>

  2. The source of best product and feature ideas reveale= d: 60% of PMs say direct customer feedback leads to their best ide= as. 28% -- nearly a third -- surprisingly admitted to copying competitors.= =C2=A0

  3. Cross-functional collaboration will play a big role in 2020: Despite a growing demand for consumer insights, 51% of respondents co= llaborate with market research on less than half their projects

= Download our 2020 Product Management Insights= Report
